result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Trimble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Trimble

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Laura N. at GLSO.
43
from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.

ADDRESS INFO for Gregory A Trimble
Current: 117 N Washington St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2016)
Prior: 172 Pierce St, Berlin, WI 54923

10:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and will accept the DA's offer.  DA recites offer, upon plea to the charge, will dismiss the repeater and request court costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the charge and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 10:13 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.  Defendant to stop and make an appointment with the DA.

Court adjourned at 8:56 a.m.
